items.q: Florida is a popular tourist ____________________ for spring vacation.
Laura ____________________ knew the solution to the math problem.
There would be a thirty-minute ____________________ before the plane could take off.
The children had very good manners and were always ____________________ in social situations.
The first draft of George's paper only required ____________________ revisions.
My mother always cries if a movie has a ____________________ ending.
Meteorologists ____________________ excellent weather for the rest of the week.
Anna can invite ____________________ fifty guests to the party.
Choose a topic and then ____________________ it down so it can work for an essay of 5-8 paragraphs.
Generate ideas about your topic by ____________________.
Make an ____________________ so you can organize how you will present your information.
Write the ____________________, making sure to get all your ideas on the paper.
Get ____________________ from a peer so you can generate ideas about improving your writing.
____________________ the first draft by adding or cutting information and correcting errors.
Proofread the final draft with a goal of ____________________ grammar and spelling errors.
a countless _____
a rational _____
anticipate a _____ problem
you must _____ concentrate
Identify the thesis statement and write it here: ______________________________________________
My mother's parents are American, but her ancestors are origin from England and Germany. a. mother's b. are c. but d. origin
I hated this translation step so much that I was determined that one day I will be able to speak to my grandparents by myself. a. hated b. was c. will d. to speak
My school was only a few blocks from our house, but my grandmother got horribly lost in the way. a. was b. from c. horribly d. in
In addition, it was a potential dangerous liability! a. In b. was c. potential d. dangerous
Most of the cards we're yellow, and I used a green pen to write the words. a. Most of b. we're c. used d. to write
During I was studying English, I realized that learning a language does more than teach you new words. a. During b. studying c. learning d. more than
American holidays a. Unusual holidays which are unique to the New England states b. Food as it relates to specific U.S. holidays c. Holidays and celebrations around the world
Medicine a. Preparing for wilderness survival b. Sports medicine and the treatment and care of athletes c. Alternative medicine for various health conditions
Crime and Punishment a. History of the death penalty in Europe b. Most common traffic violations and how to avoid them c. Raising obedient and well-mannered children
Employment a. Top five dying careers b. Memorable experiences in college c. Interviewing techniques and tips
Music a. Changes in technology since 1960 b. The Beatles and their influence on rock 'n roll c. Benefits of learning to play a musical instrument
An antonym for up to is more than . __________
Adult is a synonym for minor . __________
A synonym for a destination is a time . __________
Rude is an antonym for polite . __________
Legally is a synonym for instantly . __________
An antonym for delay is concentrate . __________
Happy is an antonym for tragic . __________
A synonym for anticipate is expect . __________
Write about the four seasons in your country. Describe what the weather is like in each season and how it affects the activities that people do. Follow the seven steps in the writing process.
